page.title: 18 THE MIDSUMMER MARKET
page.content: On Saturday the 15 of June there was a Midsummer Market in the village of Betley.The Market was to celebrate the 700th.anniversary of the start of the Church in Betley.Most of the organisations in the village were involved. Betley was granted a market charter in 1227 by King John.Because of this a market is the usual way of celebrating special events.There were stalls of all different kinds of things.There was a stall with only orange and lemon colour things.There were flowers,books and ice cream stalls. Refreshments were sold in the school. There was a barbeque with hot dogs,hamburgers etc.The school did maypole dancing in the afternoon and there was a band on the village green. A fire engine came and some people played on it.In the school playground there were games and other things.
